name: findCalls
description: To search for all calls sent or received by the user. Use "id=0" for the campaignId parameter to query for all calls sent through the POST /calls API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

fields.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

limit.description: To set the maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100

offset.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

id.description: Lists the Call ids to search for. If calls ids are specified then other query parameters can be ignored

campaignId.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

batchId.description: An id of a contact batch, queries for calls of a particular contact batch

fromNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was from. Example: 12132000384

toNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was sent to. Example: 12132000384

label.description: A label for a specific call

states.description: Searches for all calls which correspond to statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

results.description: Searches for all calls with statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

inbound.description: Filters inbound calls for "true" value and outbound calls for "false" value

intervalBegin.description: Start of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

intervalEnd.description: End of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

$block: Represents a page with results returned by query operation. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

$ul: **limit**: A maximum number of returned items. If items.size() < limit assume no more items
**offset**: An offset from a start of paging source
**totalCount**: Total count of available results. -1 if unknown
